Package algorithms.trees

Class LeastCommonAncestor

java.lang.Object
algorithms.trees.LeastCommonAncestor
public class LeastCommonAncestor extends Object
The Least Common Ancestor (LCA) problem (a.k.a. lowest common ancestor): given a tree, find the Least Common Ancestor (LCA) of a pair of nodes. The LCA of nodes and in a tree is the shared ancestor of and that is located farthest from the root.

The goal is to pre-process the data so that subsequent queries are fast.

This has been written for 0-based indexing, that is, the query indexes start at 0 and are w.r.t. the original array 'a' given to the constructor. 

 reference:
 "The LCA Problem Revisited"
 Michael A. Bender, MartÄ±n Farach-Colton
 SUNY Stony Brook, Rutgers University
 May 16, 2000

    • findWithLogN

      public int findWithLogN(int i0, int i1)
      find the least common ancestor for indices i0 and i1 where the indices are w/ respect to the original array give to constructor. It finds the index in array 'a' for the minimum value in the query index range [i0, i1]. The r.t.c. is O(log_2(n)) where n is a.length.
      Parameters:
      i0 -
      i1 -
      Returns:
      index into array 'a' of the least common ancestor of
